alert.note: Alert for Amite; Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Northern Jackson; Pearl River; Pike; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison; Southern Jackson; Walthall; Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 06 at 7:43PM CDT until August 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM CDT MONDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 120 degrees expected. * WHERE...All of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi. * WHEN...Monday and Tuesday from 11AM to 7PM. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight lows will not drop below 80 degrees, especially for urban areas. This will exacerbate the potential for heat stress/illness.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
